headline: How The Narrative Around Rightmove (LSE:RMV) Is Shifting With AI Plans And Downgrades
summary: Rightmove’s latest valuation work keeps the core fair value anchor steady at £6.57 per share, even as the surrounding narrative has become more cautious with a series of price target cuts and rating downgrades. Analysts are rethinking how much risk to attach to the new artificial intelligence driven plan and a tougher competitive backdrop, which helps explain why targets, such as JPMorgan’s moves from £6.27 to £5.55 and then to £5.00, have been reset even without a change to the central fair...

headline: What Analysts Think Is Changing The Story For Amazon.com (AMZN)
summary: Amazon.com’s modeled fair value has barely moved, shifting from about US$295.53 to about US$295.51 per share, even as the discount rate, long term revenue growth assumptions and views around AI related cloud demand, advertising and retail all continue to be debated. This tiny change reflects how bullish arguments around large AI infrastructure deals and advertising momentum are being weighed against concerns about heavier capital spending and cloud economics. As these cross currents keep...

headline: How Recent Moves Are Rewriting The Story For Archer Daniels Midland ADM
summary: Archer Daniels Midland just saw its fair value estimate edge to about US$57.09 per share, a very small change that keeps the stock in roughly the same price range even as the story around its earnings outlook becomes more debated. With Q3 earnings ahead of estimates and a fresh US$59 price target from JPMorgan, the latest update reflects a balance between support from recent results and caution around profit headwinds that analysts continue to flag. Read on to see how you can keep track of...
